ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In general, would you say your health is:
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Poor; 2 = Fair; 3 = Good; 4 = Very good; 5 = Excellent

ElementDescription: Compared to 1 year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Much worse now; 2 = Somewhat worse now; 3 = About the same now; 4 = Somewhat better now; 5 = Much better now

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often has your health limited: Heavy activities, such as running, participating in very active sports (such as gymnastics, rollerblading, skiing)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often has your health limited: Moderate activities (such as walking to school, bicycle riding)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often has your health limited: Light activities (such as carrying packages or a school bag full of books)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often has your health limited: Other daily activities (such as taking a bath/shower alone, going to and from school alone)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have physical or emotional problems caused you to: Do fewer things than you would have liked to do?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have physical or emotional problems caused you to: Limit the kind of schoolwork, chores, sports, or other activities you did?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have physical or emotional problems caused you to: Have difficulty performing the schoolwork, chores, sports, or other activities you did (for example, it took extra effort)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often: Did you skip school for no reason?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often: Were you in trouble in school (with teachers or other staff)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often: Were you in trouble out of school (with police, security guards, bus driver, etc.)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble concentrating on an activity?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble concentrating on reading?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had difficulty thinking?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had difficulty figuring out and solving problems (such as making plans, making decisions, learning new things)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had a problem with complicated projects that require organization or planning (like computer games or difficult homework)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble remembering things you read hours or days before?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble finding the correct word?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble understanding your teachers?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you: Had trouble understanding what you read?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Have someone available to help you if you needed and wanted help?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Never; 2 = Not often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Have someone you could confide in or talk to about things that were troubling you?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Never; 2 = Not often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Have someone you could talk to when you were confused and needed to sort things out?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Never; 2 = Not often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Have someone who accepted you as you were, both your good points and bad points?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Never; 2 = Not often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel that epilepsy or medications limited your social activities (such as hanging out with friends, doing extra-curricular activities) compared with social activities of others your age?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel alone and isolated from others because of your epilepsy/seizures?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Miss classes because of seizures or medications?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Use epilepsy or medication side effects as an excuse to avoid doing something you didn't really want to do?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel embarrassed or ''different'' because you had to take medications?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel that epilepsy or medications limited your school performance?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel you had limitations because of your seizures?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel that epilepsy or medications limited your independence?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel that epilepsy or medications limited your social life or dating?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Feel that epilepsy or medications limited your participation in sports or physical activities?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how did you feel: About how you looked (side effects such as weight gain, acne/pimples, hair change, etc.)?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very bad; 2 = Bad; 3 = OK; 4 = Good; 5 = Very good

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how much were you bothered by: Limits set by parents/family because of your epilepsy or medications?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = A lot; 2 = Some; 3 = Not much; 4 = A little; 5 = Not at all

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: I consider myself to be less than perfect because I have epilepsy.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: If I applied for a job, and someone else also applied who didn't have epilepsy, the employer should hire the other person.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: I can understand why someone wouldn't want to date me because I have epilepsy.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: I don't blame people for being afraid of me because I have epilepsy.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: I don't blame people for taking my opinions less seriously than they would if I didn't have epilepsy.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Please indicate the answer that comes closest to the way you have felt about yourself in the past 4 weeks: I feel that my epilepsy makes me mentally unstable.
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Indicate how often in the past 4 weeks you have had these attitudes: How good or bad has it been that you have epilepsy?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very bad; 2 = A little bad; 3 = Not sure; 4 = A little good; 5 = Very good

ElementDescription: Indicate how often in the past 4 weeks you have had these attitudes: How fair has it been that you have epilepsy?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very unfair; 2 = A little unfair; 3 = Not sure; 4 = A little fair; 5 = Very fair

ElementDescription: Indicate how often in the past 4 weeks you have had these attitudes: How happy or sad has it been for you to have epilepsy?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very sad; 2 = A little sad; 3 = Not sure; 4 = A little happy; 5 = Very happy

ElementDescription: Indicate how often in the past 4 weeks you have had these attitudes: How bad or good have you felt it is to have epilepsy?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very bad; 2 = A little bad; 3 = Not sure; 4 = A little good; 5 = Very good

ElementDescription: Indicate how often in the past 4 weeks you have had these attitudes: How often do you feel that your epilepsy has kept you from starting new things?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Worry about having another seizure?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Fear dying because of seizures?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never

ElementDescription: In the past 4 weeks, how often did you: Worry about hurting yourself during a seizure?
Notes: 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Very often; 2 = Often; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Not often; 5 = Never
